name: x1 & x2 ... or ~(x1 & x2 ...): logical AND with possible negation
description: Logical AND of several boolean scalars.

out_ports.caption: x1 & x2 &... or ~(x1 & x2 &...)
out_ports.name: output
out_ports.hint:
Result of AND operator for all inputs, maybe negated.
Will be true, if there are no input scalars (no initialized input ports).

controls.caption: Invert result
controls.name: invert
controls.description: If set, this function returns false instead of true and true instead of false.

controls.caption: What string is true
controls.name: booleanStyle
controls.description:
What boolean value is considered to be true and what is false.

C-like: true is non-zero number or non-empty string, containing not a number, false is 0, 0.0 or empty string.

Java-like: true is "true" string (ignoring case), false is any other string.

Note that "true" string, according these rules, is considered to be true in all modes.

controls.caption: Common input format
controls.name: commonInputStyle
controls.description:
If set, then every input "xK" may be specified both in C-like or in Java-like styles: it will always be recognized correctly.

In other words, if it is "true" or "false" string (ignoring case), it will be considered to be true/false correspondingly; if it is a number X, if will be translated to result of comparison X≠0 (false for "0" or "0.0", true for non-zero numbers); it it is an empty string, it will be considered to false; in any other case (non-empty string, even consisting of spaces only) it will be true.
